Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD erred in applying the reasonableness standard to the RPD's findings of fact and mixed fact and law
Application_Facts: Ms. Yani Meilina sought refugee status but was denied due to the RPD's internal flight alternative finding
Decision_Outcome: RAD's decision overturned, case sent back for re-evaluation with certification of a key legal question
Remedy_Requested: Re-determination of the case by a different RAD member
Court_Ruling: Judicial review application is granted, the RAD's decision is set aside
Defendant_Behavior: RAD applied the reasonableness standard incorrectly
Grounds_for_Claim: Unfair appeal process, incorrect standard of review applied
Assessment_Factor: Nature of legal questions, importance to the legal system
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review process analyzed the RAD's application of the reasonableness standard
Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied erroneously; correctness standard should apply to central legal questions
Application_Basis: Internal flight alternative finding by RPD
Governing_Rule: Correctness standard applies to questions of central importance to the legal system; reasonableness otherwise unless constitutional or jurisdictional issues
Harm_Assessment: Applicant did not receive a fair appeal
Cause_Description: Ms. Yani Meilina's refugee claim denied based on internal flight alternative; appeal review used wrong legal standard
Jurisdictional_Issue: No jurisdictional error found, but procedural fairness compromised
Decision_Rationale: Although the error in standard of review may not have changed outcome, lack of fair hearing requires re-determination
Decision_Making_Body: Refugee Protection Division (RPD), Refugee Appeal Division (RAD)
